# Really Severe Absence
Category: Cryptography

## Description
> The department of EEvil found out about us discovering the first message and now used the ciphertext and the public key only, what can we do?

A text file was attached.

## Solution

From the name of the challenge we can guess that it will deal with RSA.

Let's check the attached file:

```console
root@kali:/media/sf_CTFs/technion/Really_Severe_Absence# cat message.txt
n: 
e: 65537
c: 
```

Looks like we need to performs some kind of RSA attack.

We'll throw it into RsaCtfTool to try and perform a few automatic attacks:

```console
root@kali:/media/sf_CTFs/technion/Really_Severe_Absence# ~/utils/RsaCtfTool/RsaCtfTool.py -n  -e 65537 --uncipher 8280475884443238301902766146980230628472687848126906126319323068765206139274
3696063844669610423101582544292021514998542506566573270750984413170224838077112410822523871408117909191783675250944379577671700825272137906218451924396017395147430981
7792632407752531893595613023945634886073484335627891114969842757094514866385326490762801590187813216820979410597339140297371621142953797143520302153301542317266127633
6188645069861666595898121279162086328164706559785992863700645210985216818196355344504717105503508119968093791242325224960292727499096288964674434910538522152895553088

8365992675584189127670602603872844524634895984361434251942976616585377779944921306996820144060533824000170896575652600929801544807395889342796542269107705015470727016

9614028151934097727071656735879220799110118264814552564775696043526930812075200553122558801246915030601679513811525297899768203028091211460591726640842755050851793221

private argument is not set, the private key will not be displayed, even if recovered.

[*] Testing key /tmp/tmp5xubwwj7.
Can't load roca because sage is not installed

Can't load smallfraction because sage is not installed

Can't load binary_polinomial_factoring because sage is not installed
[*] Performing comfact_cn attack on /tmp/tmp5xubwwj7.

[*] Performing siqs attack on /tmp/tmp5xubwwj7.
[!] Warning: Modulus too large for SIQS attack module
[*] Performing euler attack on /tmp/tmp5xubwwj7.
[!] Timeout.
Euler: Internal Error
[*] Performing factordb attack on /tmp/tmp5xubwwj7.

00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00My dear friends of the departement of EEvil\nVaad madmach has managed to decrypt our previous message!\nIn order to keep our messages secure, from now on we'll only send the public key and ciphertext.\nAs such, only the ones with the power of the evil gods (or quantum computers) can decrypt the messages!\nHere a new flag we discovered: cstechnion{Y0u_sh0Uld_p1ck_y0uR_k3y5_w153Ly}, keeps the flags to yourselves and together, when the time comes, we'll destroy vaad madmach!\nMore flags to come.\n\nLong live the EEmpire!"
```

Looks like the tool was able to factorize `n` into `p` and `q` using [factordb](http://www.factordb.com/index.php?). From there, it's trivial to decrypt the message.

The flag: `cstechnion{Y0u_sh0Uld_p1ck_y0uR_k3y5_w153Ly}`
